alert.note: Alert for Kendall; Kerr (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 20 at 9:33PM CDT until April 21 at 3:30AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Gillespie, Kendall and Kerr. * WHEN...Until 100 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos that could flood low water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 932 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kerrville, Fredericksburg, Stonewall, Grapetown, Bankersmith, Cain City, Old Tunnel State Park, Rocky Hill, Luckenbach, Cypress Creek, Blumenthal, Tivydale, Albert, LBJ State Park, Harper and LBJ National Historical Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
